Physical comforting techniques include hugging the child, providing tactile contact like gentle hugs or reading together, massaging fingertips and earlobes, and teaching self-soothing exercises like "Butterfly hugs" (patting shoulders) and "Cocoon" (hugging shoulders and abdomen). Breathing exercises involve inhaling through the nose and slowly exhaling through the mouth (potentially with sounds like "A" or "O"), and breathing several times into the abdomen, while ensuring the child does not hold their breath.

To find detailed information, go to the website dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-children and read under the section "How can parents support a child?", specifically point 4 "Hug the baby.".
